# Paragon

## Docs

- [ActionKit Logs](https://docs.useparagon.com/actionkit/actionkit-logs.md): Search, view, and trace logs for all of your ActionKit requests.
- [ActionKit Playground](https://docs.useparagon.com/actionkit/actionkit-playground.md): Try ActionKit in the Playground, a sandbox to test chatting with an agent that has access to ActionKit tools.
- [Implementation Examples](https://docs.useparagon.com/actionkit/implementation-examples.md): See example implementations with ActionKit in common frameworks and using OpenAI's client library
- [Overview](https://docs.useparagon.com/actionkit/overview.md): ActionKit is an API to give your agentic AI product access to Paragon's catalog pre-built Integration Actions as tools.
- [Supported Integrations](https://docs.useparagon.com/actionkit/supported-integrations.md)
- [SDK / API Reference](https://docs.useparagon.com/apis/api-reference.md)
- [Multi Account Authorization](https://docs.useparagon.com/apis/api-reference/multi-account-authorization.md): Use the SDK to connect multiple accounts for the same integration.
- [Proxy API](https://docs.useparagon.com/apis/making-api-requests.md): Send requests directly to an integration provider, on behalf of Connected Users.
- [Task History API](https://docs.useparagon.com/apis/task-history.md)
- [Users API](https://docs.useparagon.com/apis/users.md)
- [Concurrency SLA](https://docs.useparagon.com/billing/concurrency-limits.md): Learn how concurrency is calculated in Paragon.
- [Connected Users](https://docs.useparagon.com/billing/connected-users.md): Learn how Connected Users are counted in Paragon.
- [Task Usage](https://docs.useparagon.com/billing/tasks.md): Learn how tasks are counted in Paragon.
- [Customizing the Connect Portal](https://docs.useparagon.com/connect-portal/connect-portal-customization.md): Control your end-user integration experience by customizing Connect Portal.
- [Displaying Workflows](https://docs.useparagon.com/connect-portal/displaying-workflows.md): Control the visibility or customize the description of workflows that appear in the Connect Portal.
- [Field Mapping](https://docs.useparagon.com/connect-portal/field-mapping.md): Use a Field Mapping User Setting to allow your users to define a mapping between objects in your application and their integration.
- [Headless Connect Portal](https://docs.useparagon.com/connect-portal/headless-connect-portal.md): Bring your existing components or design system into your Paragon integrations experience with the Headless Connect Portal.
- [Workflow Permissions](https://docs.useparagon.com/connect-portal/workflow-permissions.md): Restrict the visibility of workflows to specific users or groups with Workflow Permissions.
- [Custom Dropdowns](https://docs.useparagon.com/connect-portal/workflow-user-settings/custom-dropdowns.md): Provide your users with dropdown options from your application.
- [User Settings](https://docs.useparagon.com/connect-portal/workflow-user-settings/workflow-user-settings.md): Provide settings in the Connect Portal to allow your users to configure their integration and workflows.
- [Hosted Demo Environment](https://docs.useparagon.com/demo.md): Start testing your Paragon integrations without embedding our SDK
- [Working with Multiple Projects](https://docs.useparagon.com/deploying-integrations/projects.md): Create unique spaces for different teams to collaborate.
- [Release Environments](https://docs.useparagon.com/deploying-integrations/release-environments.md): Use Release Environments to test and deploy new integrations and integration updates.
- [Start a Free Trial](https://docs.useparagon.com/external-link-0.md)
- [Quickstart Sample App](https://docs.useparagon.com/external-link-1.md)
- [2-Minute Product Tour](https://docs.useparagon.com/external-link-2.md)
- [Workflow Templates](https://docs.useparagon.com/external-link-4.md)
- [Adding Integrations](https://docs.useparagon.com/getting-started/adding-an-integration.md)
- [Displaying the Connect Portal](https://docs.useparagon.com/getting-started/displaying-the-connect-portal.md): Connect to your users' app accounts with the Connect Portal
- [Installing the SDK](https://docs.useparagon.com/getting-started/installing-the-connect-sdk.md): The Paragon SDK can be imported in your front-end JavaScript to embed the Connect Portal and trigger workflows in your application.
- [Introduction](https://docs.useparagon.com/getting-started/introduction.md): Go from 0 to 1 by building and connecting to your first integration on Paragon
- [Managing Account Settings](https://docs.useparagon.com/managing-account/account-settings.md): Update your Account Settings, like email, password, and MFA options.
- [Role Based Access Control](https://docs.useparagon.com/managing-account/role-based-access-control.md): Assign roles to team members working together on Paragon.
- [Working with Team Members](https://docs.useparagon.com/managing-account/teams.md): Invite your team to create integrations on Paragon.
- [Managing Event Destinations](https://docs.useparagon.com/monitoring/event-destinations.md): Send notifications from your Paragon project into your logging, analytics, and APM services.
- [Sending Events to Datadog](https://docs.useparagon.com/monitoring/event-destinations/datadog.md): Send notifications from your Paragon project into Datadog.
- [Sending Events to New Relic](https://docs.useparagon.com/monitoring/event-destinations/new-relic.md): Send notifications from your Paragon project into New Relic.
- [Sending Events to Sentry](https://docs.useparagon.com/monitoring/event-destinations/sentry.md): Send notifications from your Paragon project into Sentry.
- [Sending Events to Slack](https://docs.useparagon.com/monitoring/event-destinations/slack.md): Send notifications from your Paragon project into Slack.
- [Managing Connected Users](https://docs.useparagon.com/monitoring/users.md): Manage connected users and their integrations.
- [Viewing Task History](https://docs.useparagon.com/monitoring/viewing-task-history.md): Quickly view a timeline and status of previous workflow executions.
- [Application Architecture](https://docs.useparagon.com/on-premise/application-architecture.md)
- [Choosing a Hosting Solution](https://docs.useparagon.com/on-premise/choosing-a-hosting-solution.md)
- [Configuring a Managed Instance](https://docs.useparagon.com/on-premise/configure.md)
- [Configuring Managed AWS](https://docs.useparagon.com/on-premise/configure/aws.md): Configure your managed Paragon instance on AWS.
- [Configuring Managed Azure](https://docs.useparagon.com/on-premise/configure/azure.md): Configure your managed Paragon instance on Azure.
- [Configuring Managed GCP](https://docs.useparagon.com/on-premise/configure/gcp.md): Configure your managed Paragon instance on GCP.
- [On Premise Costs](https://docs.useparagon.com/on-premise/costs.md)
- [Data Access & Controls](https://docs.useparagon.com/on-premise/data-access-and-controls.md)
- [Hosting Paragon On Premise](https://docs.useparagon.com/on-premise/hosting-paragon-on-premise.md): Learn about deploying Paragon on your own infrastructure.
- [Incident Response](https://docs.useparagon.com/on-premise/incident-response.md)
- [Infrastructure Architecture](https://docs.useparagon.com/on-premise/infrastructure-architecture.md)
- [System Metrics and Alarms](https://docs.useparagon.com/on-premise/system-metrics-and-alarms.md)
- [System Requirements](https://docs.useparagon.com/on-premise/system-requirements.md)
- [Paragon Documentation](https://docs.useparagon.com/overview.md): Embed in-app SaaS integrations that connect with your customers' apps.
- [Build and Push](https://docs.useparagon.com/paragraph/build-and-push.md)
- [Defining App Events](https://docs.useparagon.com/paragraph/defining-app-events.md): Learn how to define App Event schemas in Paragraph projects.
- [Defining Integrations](https://docs.useparagon.com/paragraph/defining-integrations.md): Learn how to define and configure workflows as code within a Paragraph project.
- [Defining Workflows](https://docs.useparagon.com/paragraph/defining-workflows.md): Learn how to define workflows as code within a Paragraph project.
- [Getting Started with Paragraph](https://docs.useparagon.com/paragraph/getting-started.md): Paragraph allows you to author and maintain Paragon integrations as code, which can be synced with a Git repository to track revisions over time.
- [Reference](https://docs.useparagon.com/paragraph/reference.md)
- [Update Guide](https://docs.useparagon.com/paragraph/reference/update-guide.md)
- [@Useparagon/Core Glossary](https://docs.useparagon.com/paragraph/reference/useparagon-core.md): Learn about the different types Paragon supports
- [Setting up Git Sync](https://docs.useparagon.com/paragraph/setting-up-git-sync.md): Connect your Git repository to sync changes made in Paragon to a version control system.
- [API Resources](https://docs.useparagon.com/resources/api-resources.md): Add API Resources to your project to build reusable Triggers and Steps for your API in Workflows.
- [Custom Integrations](https://docs.useparagon.com/resources/custom-integrations.md): Create your own custom integration with any app provider on Paragon.
- [Custom Webhooks](https://docs.useparagon.com/resources/custom-webhooks.md): Create your own custom webhook with any integration provider on Paragon.
- [Overview](https://docs.useparagon.com/resources/integrations.md)
- [ActiveCampaign](https://docs.useparagon.com/resources/integrations/activecampaign.md): Connect to your users' ActiveCampaign accounts.
- [Adobe Acrobat Sign](https://docs.useparagon.com/resources/integrations/adobe-acrobat-sign.md): Connect to your users' Adobe Acrobat Sign accounts.
- [Adobe Experience Manager](https://docs.useparagon.com/resources/integrations/adobe-experience-manager.md): Connect to your users' Adobe Experience Manager accounts.
- [ADP Workforce Now](https://docs.useparagon.com/resources/integrations/adp-workforce-now.md): Connect to your users' ADP Workforce Now accounts.

- [Workday](https://docs.useparagon.com/resources/integrations/workday.md): Connect to your users' Workday accounts

- [Zendesk](https://docs.useparagon.com/resources/integrations/zendesk.md): Connect to your users' Zendesk accounts.
- [Zendesk Sell](https://docs.useparagon.com/resources/integrations/zendesksell.md): Connect to your users' Zendesk Sell accounts.
- [Zoho CRM](https://docs.useparagon.com/resources/integrations/zohocrm.md): Connect to your users' Zoho CRM accounts.
- [Zoho People](https://docs.useparagon.com/resources/integrations/zohopeople.md): Connect to your users' Zoho People accounts.
- [Zoom](https://docs.useparagon.com/resources/integrations/zoom.md): Connect to your users' Zoom accounts.
- [JavaScript Libraries](https://docs.useparagon.com/resources/javascript-libraries.md)
- [Paragon User Token Generator](https://docs.useparagon.com/resources/user-token.md)
- [GDPR](https://docs.useparagon.com/security/gdpr.md): GDPR at Paragon
- [Security](https://docs.useparagon.com/security/security.md): Paragon's Security and Change Management Procedures.
- [Service Level Agreement](https://docs.useparagon.com/security/sla.md)
- [Trust Center](https://docs.useparagon.com/security/trust-center.md)
- [Contacting Support](https://docs.useparagon.com/support/contacting-support.md)
- [Building a BambooHR Integration](https://docs.useparagon.com/tutorials/building-a-bamboohr-integration.md): In this tutorial, we'll build a basic BambooHR integration that syncs employees from your app to your customers' BambooHR accounts.
- [Building a HubSpot Integration](https://docs.useparagon.com/tutorials/building-a-hubspot-integration.md): In this tutorial, we'll build a basic HubSpot integration that syncs contacts from your app to your customers' HubSpot accounts.
- [Building a Marketo Integration](https://docs.useparagon.com/tutorials/building-a-marketo-integration.md): In this tutorial, we'll build a basic Marketo integration that syncs leads from your app to lists in your customers' Marketo accounts.
- [Building a Salesforce Integration](https://docs.useparagon.com/tutorials/building-a-salesforce-integration.md): In this tutorial, we'll build a basic Salesforce integration that syncs leads from your app to your customers' Salesforce accounts.
- [Building a Slack Integration](https://docs.useparagon.com/tutorials/building-a-slack-integration.md): In this tutorial, we'll build a basic Slack integration that sends notifications from your app to your customers' Slack accounts.
- [Building an In-App Integrations Catalog](https://docs.useparagon.com/tutorials/building-an-in-app-integrations-catalog.md): In this tutorial, we'll use the Paragon SDK to build an integrations catalog into your app.
- [Advanced Techniques](https://docs.useparagon.com/workflows/advanced-techniques.md)
- [Implementing Custom Field Mapping](https://docs.useparagon.com/workflows/advanced-techniques/implementing-custom-field-mapping.md)
- [Polling Based Workflows](https://docs.useparagon.com/workflows/advanced-techniques/polling-based-workflows.md)
- [Triggering Workflows in Workflows](https://docs.useparagon.com/workflows/advanced-techniques/triggering-workflows-in-workflows.md)
- [Auto Retries](https://docs.useparagon.com/workflows/auto-retries.md): Automatically retry failed step executions.
- [Building Workflows](https://docs.useparagon.com/workflows/building-workflows.md): Workflows connect data between your users' apps and your application
- [Environment Secrets](https://docs.useparagon.com/workflows/environment-secrets.md): Securely store and access credentials across your workflows.
- [Using Functions](https://docs.useparagon.com/workflows/functions.md)
- [Smart Rate Limits](https://docs.useparagon.com/workflows/handling-rate-limits.md): Learn how Workflows automatically recover from integration API rate limits.
- [Integration Actions](https://docs.useparagon.com/workflows/integration-actions.md)
- [Making API Requests](https://docs.useparagon.com/workflows/requests.md): Making HTTP requests with Paragon
- [Request Pagination](https://docs.useparagon.com/workflows/requests/request-pagination.md): Configuring requests for data that span multiple pages.
- [Triggering Workflows](https://docs.useparagon.com/workflows/triggers.md): Triggering workflows in Paragon
- [API Resource Trigger](https://docs.useparagon.com/workflows/triggers/api-resource-trigger.md): Trigger workflows with your existing webhooks API
- [App Events](https://docs.useparagon.com/workflows/triggers/app-events.md)
- [Integration Enabled Trigger](https://docs.useparagon.com/workflows/triggers/integration-enabled-trigger.md)
- [Integration Trigger](https://docs.useparagon.com/workflows/triggers/integration-trigger.md)
- [Request Trigger](https://docs.useparagon.com/workflows/triggers/request-trigger.md)
- [Scheduler Trigger](https://docs.useparagon.com/workflows/triggers/scheduler-trigger.md)
- [Using Conditionals](https://docs.useparagon.com/workflows/using-conditionals.md): Add conditional branching logic to your workflows
- [Using Dynamic Variables](https://docs.useparagon.com/workflows/using-dynamic-variables.md): Pass data from your application, the Connect Portal, and previous steps.
- [Using Fan Out](https://docs.useparagon.com/workflows/using-fan-out.md): Run a sequence of steps over each object in an array.
- [Version History](https://docs.useparagon.com/workflows/version-history.md): Review and restore previous versions of your workflow. Check or revert to earlier workflow versions.
- [Working with Files](https://docs.useparagon.com/workflows/working-with-files.md)
